head.title: Journal Kept at Slave Lake, 1802. - Page #1

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #1 of 16 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Wentzel, Willard Ferdinand. Journal Kept at Slave Lake, 1802. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0013

div.p: Journal Kept at Slave Lake Summer 1802. Begining August Saturday 21st[.]
Early in the morning Mr Thomson with 4 men in a large Canoe laden with 14 Packs Set out for Athabasca.

The Potties visited their nets five times to Day the report is that they did not breakfast this morning – & that they intend to go to L'Isle D'Orignal in order to fish for their living there[.] [T]hey told our men that they had a little pimican remoining of their provisions from Athabasca but they take good care to keep it till they are pinched with Hunger[.] Adams byr inlaw who had been a Hunting arrived[.] He tells us that he missed at an Orignal & saw a great m[any] Gibiers but too great blockhead to kill any[.] Tourcotte plastered the inside of the Hall & John Dutchman did the same to the chimney[.] 14 Ps of Fish in the n[ets.]
Sunday 22nd[.] Tourquotte busy plastering the House all Day[.] John made a Hearth to the Chimney[.] 14 Pieces Fish in the nets[.]

Monday 23rd[.] Monsieur L'Allemand went to watch at the pt while Mandville came to work at the House[.] After Sun Set arriv[ed] Adam with 4 Indians Gave them Drams & bits of Tobacc[o] […] news[.] That he had hired an Indian to take him to […] the Grand Coquin, Trois Pouce, &c was – but after marchi[ng] [to] & fró 2 Days they were compelled to return with no success[.] The Above Indians brought nothing – they came Here in order to go up the River & join the Band where Morrin is[.] There are 4 more montagniers gone up the the River au Rat & are to come out a little above the Beaver Island – in the Month of September that is to say if they kill nothing[.] 18 Ps of Fish in the nets[.] Fine weather[.]

Tuesday 24th[.] Traded 4 Skins meat & 1 beaver skin[.] Gave out a few Credits & a few articles gratis pursuant to Mr Thomsons orders[.] Adam returned part of the Equipment that Mr T. had given him[.] I had not t[he] time to look over his expences but I believe them not great[.] 12 Ps Fish[.] Adam help'd to scrub the House & put in bedsteads[.] Fine weather[.] Four of the Indians went a Hunting[.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
